intro: Pedicularis omiiana subsp. omiiana, commonly known as the Omiian Lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers, which are adapted for pollination by insects. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it derives some nutrients from its host plants. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of plant adaptation to extreme climates.
